episode_title: 522 - The One With Joey’s Big Break

content.description: Central Perk, everyone but Phoebe are there reading. Rachel is sitting on the couch flanked by Ross and Monica. She suddenly stops reading and starts blinking her left eye as if it’s bothering her. The problem is that Joey is on her left and thinks she’s winking at him and winks back. Ross is watching this and isn’t quite sure of what to make of it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, my eye is a little itchy.
(Ross turns to look at Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhhh, mine too! Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! It’s really red! You should go see my eye doctor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Richard? I’m not gonna go see your ex-boyfriend!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, Richard. That’s all I ever hear, Richard, Richard, Richard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Since we’ve been going out, I think I’ve mentioned his name twice!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so Richard, Richard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s not Richard! Okay? It’s this new guy and he’s really good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’m sorry I’m not going to an eye doctor!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God, here we go!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Anytime anything comes close to touching her eye or anyone else’s she like freaks out. Watch! Watch! (He takes his finger and moves it towards his eye.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Come on! That’s all right! Fine—Okay, I have a weird thing about my eye. Can we not talk about it please?

content.speaker: All
content.text: All right, fine.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, remember that great song, Me, Myself, and I ? (And on the “I” part she mimics poking her eye.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica! Come on!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, does anybody want to get some lunch? All those in favor say I? (Pokes his eye)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! Stop it! Come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How much did I love The King and I ? (Oh, you get the point by now.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too! Me too! Me too! (Yeah, he does the same thing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just stop it! Come on!
(Joey howls in pain and holds his eye.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You okay there man?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I got too excited!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I gotta go. I’m taking Ben to the park.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, give him a kiss for me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, bye!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Later! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I am so sorry you got caught in the middle of that. I didn’t mean to be so out there. I am furious with him!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow umm, calm down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m trying, but man that guy can push my buttons!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why are so mad at him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, I don’t wanna talk about it. Okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, it just seems that…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You wanna be on my list too? Keep talking! Has anyone seem my list by the way?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, no Pheebs. What’s it look like?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh, it’s a piece of paper and it says, “Ross” on it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey. I just got off the phone with Estelle and guess what. (Pause, then very excitedly) I GOT THE LEAD IN A MOVIE!!!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You got the lead in a movie? That’s amazing! What’s the movie about?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s called Shutter Speed, it’s really cool! Yeah, umm, I meet this girl in the subway and we fall in love in like a day, right? And then , she disappears… But I find out where she lives and when I get there this like old lady answers the door and I say, “Where’s Betsy?” Right? And she says, “Betsy’s been dead for 10 years.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh-oh, chilling!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And the best part is, we’re filming in the desert outside Vegas! (To Chandler) And you know what that means buddy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I know that means buddy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Road trip! Yeah, we can rent a car! I just have to be there by Tuesday!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wait, my grandmother’s dead.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, uh, we can talk about that too Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No, her cab! She probably won’t be using it; you can drive it to Las Vegas.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Thanks Pheebs!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa-whoa-whoa, what are we going to do about my job?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh umm, not go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, great, road trip baby! (To Monica) This okay with you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! You don’t have to ask for my permission. (Quietly) You can go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Rach, come on! We’re gonna be late for the eye doctor appointment!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right! Let’s get this over with! Ugh! (She walks by the table and notices that no one is looking and accidentally on purpose knocks over the open cereal box.) Ohhh! No! Look what I did! (She starts walking through the mess. {Also, notice the continuity error in this scene. Note the position of the box and dispersal pattern of the cereal before and after the camera cut.}) Oh, I mean, look at this mess! I mean, we’re probably gonna have to clean this up! Y’know? We’re gonna have to reschedule!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No. If you thought this mess is going to bother me, you are wrong! All right, let’s go Blinky! (She ushers Rachel out the door, but before the door fully closes she sticks her head back in.) Chandler!!!! (Chandler agrees to clean up the mess.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is reading a map as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey Joey! What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t decide which route to take to Vegas. Hey, you’ve traveled a lot right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I’ve been around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, so-so which route should I take the northern route or the southern route?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, if you take the northern route there’s a man in Illinois with a beard of bees. {Okay, I must protest this, I’ve lived in Illinois all my life and know of no man with a beard of bees! Wisconsin, on the other hand, might be a different story.}

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Problem solved!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But on the southern route there’s a chicken that plays tic-tac-toe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, back to square one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I know a way that you can decide! All right, I’m going to ask you a series of questions and you answer as quickly as you can.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good, but wait. Okay, all right, here we go. Now I want you to relax. Take a deep breath. Clear your mind. (Quickly) Which do you like better peanut butter or egg whites?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Peanut butter!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which would you rather be a fireman or a swimmer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: A swimmer!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica. Oh… huh, I always thought it would be Rachel.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No thinking! No thinking! Tie or ascot?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ascot!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: North route or south route?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: North route!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bamn! There you go! Huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! That was incredible! Beard of bees, here I come!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, this guy again. (She ignores him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey man, what’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, not much. You guys want to see a movie tonight?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure, what do you want to see?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, umm…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I know how we can decide. Phoebe, show him your game!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, no thank you. (She gets up and moves to the couch. They were at a table previously.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s with her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. But hey, I know we can decide. Okay, I’m gonna ask you questions and you answer real quick. Okay?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What do you like better action or comedy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Action.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who would you rather sleep with Monica or Rachel?
(Ross pauses and looks at him, Joey motions for him to hurry up.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dude, you are sick.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I forgot you had that whole Rachel thing.

content.description: Monica’s eye doctor’s office, Monica and Rachel are waiting in an exam room and looking at this big white thing used to check eyes. I have no idea what it is, and if an ophthalmologist happens to know what that is, let me know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! What does that thing do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s an eye removal machine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I’m outta here!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m kidding! I’m kidding!
(Rachel heads for the door but is intercepted by the doctor.)

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: Hi Rachel!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: The Doctor
content.text: I’m Dr. Miller. Monica told me you were a little nervous, but don’t worry everything’s gonna be just fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So were done then!

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Almost! But first, we gotta start.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: This is a glaucoma test.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Sit down.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: But your chin here. (She does so.) Now, you’ll feel a small puff of air in each eye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A small puff of air, now come on!

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Here we go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: 1…2…3! (Rachel jerks back on 3.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. All right, I’ll just stay in here this time. (Puts her head back.) Okay.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Ready?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: 1…2… (She flinches on 2 this time.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, I’m gonna hold her head.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: That’s okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Monica backs off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay!

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: 1…2! (She flinches again.) (Gives up.) Y’know what? You’re young; you probably don’t have glaucoma.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great!! It was very, very nice to meet you sir—Ow! Hey! What are you doing?! Are you crazy! (He took out that thing they use to look at people’s retinas and looked at Rachel’s when she was shaking his hand causing her to flinch and scream at him.)

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Okay. You’ve got a small, minor infection in that left eye. I want you to take these drops three times a day and you’ll be as good as new.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, no, I don’t-I don’t put things in my eye.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Okay then, I guess we’ll see you back here in three months.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: And I’ll fit you for a glass eye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, just give me the damn drops! (Grabs them and storms out.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dr. Miller? (She covers her right eye and reads from the chart) P E C F D.

content.speaker: Dr. Miller
content.text: Very good Monica! You know where they are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I sure do! (She runs over to a drawer, opens it, and grabs a lollipop.) (To Rachel) And you don’t get one!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe, Rachel, Monica, and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’know, I-I gotta tell ya, those eye drops are a miracle. My eye is a 100% better.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re still in my coat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Damn!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! You ready to go?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, listen, how cold is it going to be there? Do I need a coat or will all these sweater vests be enough? (Holds up 3 of them in different colors.)
(Monica stares at him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love you.

{There’s another continuity error here. Before Monica says I love you, Chandler’s holding the vests so that you couldn’t see the collar, you could see all three, and they were folding nicely. After she says the line and the camera cuts back to Chandler, you can only see two out of the three, you can see the collar of the top one, and it looks like it was folded sloppily, unlike before. Hey, you notice things while spending this much time on this!}

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, I wish Ross was coming with us! Y’know? I’m gonna miss him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks a lot! I just got that jerk out of my mind!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, so where are we staying? Is the movie putting us up in a big hotel suite?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh no, not really. It’s an independent film y’know? So we don’t have a real big budget. I figured I’d just stay in your room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see, but once you get your first paycheck you’ll be springing a big hotel suite, right? I mean, lead in a movie, they must be paying you a lot?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah! For every dollar Shutter Speed makes, one penny of it goes right in Joey’s pocket.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you don’t get paid unless the movie makes money?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did you not hear the plot of the movie? “She’s been dead for ten years.” I’m gonna be a millionaire!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just wanna say good-bye to you guys and to see if you guys will place a little bet for me, huh? Twenty bucks on black 15.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You got it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right!
(Joey nods to Chandler, no way!)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, bye-bye now!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye you guys!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye-bye!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I wanna say good-bye at the car!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Anybody want to say good-bye to me at the car?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, I’ll say good-bye to you at the car if you don’t mind the puss.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See ya! (Walks out.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, wait a minute! The puss is good! It means it’s healing! (Runs after him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, what ‘cha reading? (Phoebe ignores him) Pheebs? (Turns away) Hello? (He sits down next to her and she moves over a bit.) Phoebe? (He moves closer and she keeps moving away.) Phoe-Phoebe! (They end up hanging over the arm rest.) Come on! (He grabs the magazine away from her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t see you there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe, are you, are you mad at me, or something? ’Cause if are please, tell me what it is I did!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if you don’t know I can’t help you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I can’t help you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, whatever it is I’m-I’m very, very sorry. Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Apology accepted.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. So we’re, we’re good?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. (Gets up.) I’ll uh, I’ll see you later, okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Bye, fat ass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: ALL RIGHT!! Phoebe now come on! Will you please tell me what it is I did that mad you so mad at me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know! I don’t remember!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well if you can’t remember, can’t we just forget about this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no, I am mad at you. I know that much. But, I am sorry about the fat ass thing. You actually have a very sweet little hiney.
(Ross isn’t sure what to do with that comment.)

content.description: Phoebe’s cab, Joey and Chandler are headed across the George Washington bridge on their way to Las Vegas. Joey is driving.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, I’m getting pretty tired. You’re might have to take over soon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’ve been driving for a half-hour, and you haven’t looked at the road once.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t worry, it’s out there! (Just then a horn honks and Joey quickly looks at the road.) I think I just need lunch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You wanna eat? (Pulls out the twenty) My treat!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Isn’t that Ross’s money?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Okay. Ross’s treat! Where do you wanna eat?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, hey, I know how we can decide! All right, uh, I’m gonna ask you a bunch of questions and then you have to answer real fast. Okay? So uh, clear your mind Clear it right out! Clear it out! Clear!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, uhh, would you rather be too wet or too dry?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Too dry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you believe in ghosts, yes or no?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is this movie gonna be my big break?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude you said, “No!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I also said, “Yes!”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You don’t think this is going to be a big break for me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! (Realizes) Ahhh!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t believe this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look Joe, I just, I just don’t want to get your hopes up real high.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about?! I’m the lead in a movie!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: They’re not even paying ya! This doesn’t even sound like a real movie!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? I don’t need this! Okay? I don’t know why you’re dumping all over my big break.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe, I don’t think this is going to be your big break.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that why you’re on this trip, huh? Make me feel like a loser? ’Cause if it is, I’ll tell ya, I-I-I’d rather be alone.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you don’t want me on the trip?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not if you’re gonna be like this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I’ll tell ya what, the next time you ask me a question like that I’ll lie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! I don’t want you on the trip!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, fine! Fine! Why don’t you pull over? I’ll get out right now!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! (He slams on the brakes, stopping the car on the bridge to the sound of numerous car horns.) Get out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re not actually supposed to stop on the bridge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!! (Gets out and Joey speeds away.) Wait! Wait, there’s no sidewalk! Yeah, I’m gonna die here.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there. Ross is trying to figure out why Phoebe’s mad at him.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, are you mad at me because my hair gel smells?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you angry at me because I said your handwriting is childlike?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No that made me feel precious.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I know! Umm, is it because he’s always correcting people’s grammar? Whom! Whom! Sometimes it’s who!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? Sometimes it’s… (Does the fist thing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, did you beat him at a board game? He turns into such a baby when he starts to lose.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’m the baby. (Points at his eye.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Eh! Stop it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! What are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey kicked me out of the car on the George Washington bridge!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know! He went crazy! Y’know, we were playing that game where you-you ask a question and you answer it really fast.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That game should not be played without my supervision.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I don’t know what mad him so mad, y’know? All I said was that uh, I didn’t think this wasn’t gonna be his big break, that this movie wasn’t going to do anything for him, and that uh, y’know it didn’t sound like a real movie—Okay, he should’ve pushed me off of the bridge.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What’s in the bag?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I figured you guys would all be mad at me. So I got you some gifts that I found on the side of the road. (Looks into the bag.) Who wants the teddy bear with one leg?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I do!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is trying to apply her eye drops while Monica looks on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (She tilts her head back and squeezes the eyedropper. The only problem is, it’s not over her eye.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not even close.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, then y’know what? Help me! I need help! I can’t do this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! All right! Let’s do it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sit down. (They sit down on the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Put your head back.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, open your eyes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, they are. (No they’re not.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How many fingers am I holding up? (She’s not holding any up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Four.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God, I was thinking four.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! All right, y’know what? Why don’t we start with a practice run? Okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No drops!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: On three, 1…2…3! (Rachel turns her head on three to avoid the drops.) Now my pillow’s all wet! (She was trying to fool Rachel and squeezed the eyedropper.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, well, you said it was practice!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Then why did you move?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because I knew you were lying!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, come here! (She gets up and drags Rachel off of the couch by her legs.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you? Monica!! Stop it!! Oh my God! Stop it! (Monica drags her totally onto the floor and on her back.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am going… I’m going—Turn it over! (Rachel rolled onto her stomach and Monica rolls her back.) I’m… I am going to get these drops in your eyes. (She is holding Rachel down with both hands and has the eyedropper in her mouth.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You really are freakishly strong!
(Monica starts biting on the eyedropper, spraying the fluid all over. But Rachel keeps turning her head back and forth and Monica keeps missing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica! Stop it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Damn! It’s empty!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow, y’know if Joey and Chandler walked in right now, we could make a fortune! (Monica is straddling Rachel and holding her arms down. In a rather risqu� pose, at least for primetime TV.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, time lapse, Phoebe and Monica are playing cards as the phone rings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh that is definitely Chandler, Joey, or Ross. (Thinks) Or-or Rachel!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens.) (To Phoebe) It’s Joey. (Phoebe’s proud of herself.) (To Joey) I’m so glad you called! Chandler told me what happened. Y’know he’s really upset about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not as upset as he’s gonna be when he finds out what I did with his sweater vests!
content.parenthetical: on a pay phone holding a box

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did you do to his sweater vests?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s just say there’s a well-dressed pack of dogs in Ohio. Hey Monica listen is-is Phoebe there? I gotta ask her something about the car.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, she’s here. Hold on a second. (She hands the phone to Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, dude!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs! Listen, this wooden box keeps sliding out from under the seat. What-what is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’s my grandma. (Joey holds the box away from him.) And thanks Joey she’s having a really great time. (Joey is happy now.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that Joey? Is that Joey? Let me talk to him! I wanna talk to him!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay Joey? Chandler’s here, he was wondering… (We hear the dial tone as Joey hangs up.) Okay, I guess he ran out of change.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, he won’t even talk to me. How am I going to apologize to him if he won’t even talk to me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las Vegas he’ll know that you’re sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a good idea. I wonder where I could (Pause) get a basket of porn…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, don’t-don’t say I’m sorry with porn!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what you should send him? A cartoon of cigarettes. ’Cause that why he could trade it for protection. No. That’s prison.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay Pheebs, I know how we’re going to figure this out. Okay, clear your mind and answer the first thing that comes into your head. Okay?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What do you like better flora or fauna?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fauna.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who would you rather be Simon or Garfunkle?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Garfunkle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why are you mad at me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You said I was boring—Ohh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: When did I say you were boring?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, I remember now! We were playing chess!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe! You and I have never played chess!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, come on! Yes, remember that time on the frozen lake? We were playing chess, you said I was boring, and then you took off your energy mask and you were Cameron Diaz! (Realizes) Okay, there’s a chance this may have been a dream.

content.description: [Scene: The desert outside of Las Vegas, Joey is arriving and we hear the song, Name. Y’know, (singing) I’ve been through the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to be out of the rain. In the desert, you can’t remember your name, ’cause there ain’t no one for to give you no pain. La…la…la-la-la, la, la, la, la-la-la. You get the idea. Anyhoo, he pulls up and stops. As he gets out of the car, he spills a huge pill of fast food containers out of the foot well.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey! Stanley! Hey-hey! You’re leading man is here! Let’s get to work.

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: Umm, slight change of plans. We’ve shut down.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wh-what?! Why?!

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: It’s a money thing, we don’t have any.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re kidding right?

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: It-it’s probably just temporary. We’re hoping to get some more money soon, so if could just uh, hang out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, hang out?! How long?

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: I don’t know. A week? Maybe two? The money will turn up! People will always wanna invest in movies! Hey, you’re not rich are ya?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Stanley
content.text: Eh, worth a shot. (Gets into his car.) Look Joey, let me know where you’re staying, okay? (The car peels away.)
(I think one of the grips walk up to Joey, mainly because there’s a credit for The Grip. What the heck is a grip anyway?!)

content.speaker: The Grip
content.text: Hey pal, are you Joey Tribbiani?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: The Grip
content.text: These got left for ya. (He hands him a bunch of helium balloons.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks. (The grip walks away.) (Reading the card.) Congratulations on your big break.

(The rest of the crew start to drive away leaving Joey sad, alone, and holding his congratulatory balloons as the song comes up again. La-la-la. See, I’ve been through the desert on a horse with no name! It felt good to be out of the rain! In the desert you can’t remember your name, ’cause there ain’t no one for to give you no pain. La-la-la, la, la, la…)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the phone is ringing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Monica, it’s Joey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey Joey! Aww, you remembered even though you’re a big star!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aw, come on! It’ll be years before I forget you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what’s it like on a movie set, huh? Do you have a dressing room? Do you have a chair with your name on it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, well yeah-yeah, I’ve got all of that going on. Yeah, listen uh, I want you to make sure you tell Chandler that he couldn’t have been more wrong! Uh-oh! I gotta go Monica, my uh, my sushi’s here!
[Cut to Joey hanging up the phone in Vegas. He’s wearing a Roman gladiator’s uniform and goes over to join a family to pose for a picture. You see, he’s apparently taken a job at Caesar’s Palace.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sorry about that. Thanks for waitin’.

content.speaker: The Husband
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Everybody smile! (The picture is taken) Okay, thanks a lot! Enjoy your stay at Caesar’s ! We hope it’s toga-rrific! (The family leaves.) Kill me. Kill me now.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, The gang is surrounding Rachel at key positions.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Rach, can you pass me the TV Guide ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yep!
(As she moves to get it, Monica yells…)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Go!!

(Phoebe jumps to the floor as Ross tackles Rachel off of the couch. Chandler helps push Rachel onto the floor by jumping over the back of the couch. Phoebe grabs Rachel’s head to hold it still and opens Rachel’s eye as Monica jumps onto Chandler’s back to administer the torture—I mean medicine.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!! Stop it! Stop it! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! Okay! Okay! (She succeeds in getting the eye drops in and everyone climbs off of Rachel.) We’ll see you in about 3 to 4 hours.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! (She’s trying to recover while still on the floor.)
